alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:27AM PST until January 15 at 1:40PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff is expected. * WHERE...Soquel Creek in Santa Cruz County. * WHEN...Until 530 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM PST, Gauge reports indicate flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 6 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Capitola and Soquel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
